popt4jlib.neural

Class FFNN4TrainBGrad

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.neural.FFNN4TrainBGrad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, VecFunctionIntf

    public class FFNN4TrainBGrad
extends java.lang.Object
implements VecFunctionIntf
    FFNN4TrainBGrad implements the gradient function of an FFNN4TrainB feed forward neural network function. It uses the auto-differentiation functionality built-into the FFNN4TrainB class.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private FFNN4TrainB _ffnn 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn)
      public constructor assumes that the network has been fully initialized with appropriate call to its finalizeInitialization(n) method before invoking this constructor.
      FFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn, int num_input_signals)
      public constructor initializes the network by calling the network's finalizeInitialization(n) method with argument the second argument passed to this constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VectorIntf eval(VectorIntf x, java.util.HashMap p)
      computes the gradient of the feed-forward neural network associated with this object at the specified weights given by x.
      double evalCoord(VectorIntf x, java.util.HashMap p, int coord)
      computes the partial derivative of the feed-forward neural network (with biases) on the weights given by x with respect to the coordinate coord.
      private double evalCoordNoClearParams(VectorIntf x, java.util.HashMap p, int coord)
      same as evalCoord() but does NOT clear the "hiddenws$i$" and "outputws" of the parameters passed to the evalPartialDerivativeB() method of the FFNN4TrainB object associated with this auto-differentiator object.
      java.lang.String toString(VectorIntf g, java.util.HashMap p)
      return a string representing the vector passed as first argument, according to the layers and structure of the neural network this gradient evaluator is for.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • FFNN4TrainBGrad

        public FFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn)
        public constructor assumes that the network has been fully initialized with appropriate call to its finalizeInitialization(n) method before invoking this constructor.
        Parameters:
        ffnn - FFNN4TrainB

      • FFNN4TrainBGrad

        public FFNN4TrainBGrad(FFNN4TrainB ffnn,
                       int num_input_signals)
        public constructor initializes the network by calling the network's finalizeInitialization(n) method with argument the second argument passed to this constructor.
        Parameters:
        ffnn - FFNN4TrainB
        num_input_signals - int the number needed for the initialization of the network.

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        public VectorIntf eval(VectorIntf x,
                       java.util.HashMap p)
        computes the gradient of the feed-forward neural network associated with this object at the specified weights given by x. The computation of the partial derivatives is exact (does not rely on GradApproximator) due to the auto-differentiation capabilities of the FFNN4TrainB class.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface VecFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf the weights variables of the FFNN
        p - HashMap the parameters that must contain the traindata and train labels
        Returns:
        VectorIntf the gradient of the network at the given weights

      • evalCoord

        public double evalCoord(VectorIntf x,
                        java.util.HashMap p,
                        int coord)
        computes the partial derivative of the feed-forward neural network (with biases) on the weights given by x with respect to the coordinate coord.
        Specified by:
        evalCoord in interface VecFunctionIntf
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf the weights at which the evaluation of the partial derivative takes place
        p - HashMap must contain keys "ffnn.traindata" and "ffnn.trainlabels"
        coord - int must be in {0,...#weights-1}
        Returns:
        double

      • evalCoordNoClearParams

        private double evalCoordNoClearParams(VectorIntf x,
                                      java.util.HashMap p,
                                      int coord)
        same as evalCoord() but does NOT clear the "hiddenws$i$" and "outputws" of the parameters passed to the evalPartialDerivativeB() method of the FFNN4TrainB object associated with this auto-differentiator object.
        Parameters:
        x - VectorIntf
        p - HashMap
        coord - int
        Returns:
        double

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(VectorIntf g,
                                 java.util.HashMap p)
        return a string representing the vector passed as first argument, according to the layers and structure of the neural network this gradient evaluator is for.
        Parameters:
        g - VectorIntf
        p - HashMap must contain value for the key "ffnn.traindata".
        Returns:
        String
